body.p: I give you in explanation of the petition of Col Alexander, the following statement,

Myself & Col Alexander were in a drinking saloon, he was thoroughly intoxicated, wild with excitement, and almost frantic, had his pistol out in his hand, it was I now believe cocked at the time, friends came in & he invited them to drink, among others the deceased Come into the room Alexander in a friendly & free manner asked him to come up and drink which he did they were talking, for a moment afterwards when I heard the report of a pistol and the deceased fell and died immediately

I am of the opinion that it is true that the shooting occured unintentionally upon the part of Alexander, at least I am sure that he did not know what he was doing he was so completely overcome with the effects of the spiritous liquors & excitement

Wayne Co,
Pardon
F. N. Alexander
Pardon issued
E L V
24th May 1865
